intro: Sterculia steyermarkii, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The tree produces woody pods that contain seeds with silky hairs, aiding in wind dispersal. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
